Column Comment.0: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.1: INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item.
Column Comment.2: MAINTAINANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the maintenance scheduleidentifier.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: INSTRUCTIONS: Use this column to capture instructions about how to deal with thebusiness associate, or what process should be followed for the maintenance.
Column Comment.7: MAINTENANCE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: Validated business associate id for theBUSINESS ASSOCIATE who conducted or was responsible for the maintenance.Note that additional contact information may be captured in RM INFO ITEM BA
Column Comment.8: MAINTENANCE COMPLETED DATE: the date when the last maintenance eventwas completed.
Column Comment.9: MAINTENANCE DUE DATE: the date when the next maintenance event is due.
Column Comment.10: MAINENANCE PERIOD VALUE: the number of periods that elapse betweenscheduled maintenance cycles, such as the interval between updates of a dataset.
Column Comment.11: MAINTENANCE PERIOD: The type of frequency of or period between typicalmaintenance occurences, such as the period between updates of a file. Usually daysor months.
Column Comment.12: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SCHEDULED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that the maintence of thisinformtaion is scheduled by a service agreement. Y indicates that there is ascheduled agreement in place. N indicates that no scheduled agreement is in place;in this case, updates would be aquired on an as requested basis.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
